title: Definitions
context: [PART VIII.] IMPACT FEES ยง264-121 Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context requires otherwise: &ldquo;Capital costs&rdquo; means part or all of the cost for capital improvements. Capital costs may include costs to acquire right-of-way, plan, design, engineer, finance, and construct improvements including costs of management and consultant fees. Capital costs shall not include periodic maintenance and other operating costs. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of transportation. &ldquo;Development&rdquo; means any artificial change to real property that requires a county grading or building permit including but not limited to construction, expansion, enlargement, alteration, or erection of buildings or structures. &ldquo;Director&rdquo; means the director of transportation. &ldquo;Impact fee&rdquo; means an assessment on a development used to incrementally fund a fair share of the capital costs of public highway improvements reasonably needed to serve that development. &ldquo;State highway improvements&rdquo; means capital improvements to the physical infrastructure of state highways. [L 2004, c 155, pt of ยง2; am L 2006, c 197, ยง1]
